title: Saint Croix National Scenic Riverway: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit                   Things To Do               River Conditions               River Safety               Join Us               Get There               Rent Equipment         Â    Do you need a day or more on the river? We want to help you plan a trip!  Get ready for eagles and smallmouth bass, rapids and riffles, intimate backwaters and big-river experiences. Your encounter with the St. Croix and Namekagon rivers can stretch over 250 miles!    Where to begin? This "Plan Your Visit" section will get you started:     Basic Information includes what you need to know about fees and passes, reservations, river conditions, weather, and a list of outfitters who can help you get out there. The maps you will need are under Directions and Transportation. Thing to Do provides you information about paddling, camping, fishing, hiking, and more.  If you need help deciding where to go, Trip Itineraries points out some great river stretches. Find out about ranger programs and events on the Calendar. Be prepared for a fun trip by thinking about Safety first. Accessibility outlines special features. If you want more, Nearby Attractions is the page about the valley.
